intro: Bupleurum altaicum, commonly known as the Altai cicely, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its small white to pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. The roots of Bupleurum altaicum are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
